boardgame.name: Illiterati
boardgame.description:
The Illiterati are an evil secret organization that has taken over the world. Your job as a member of the League of Librarians is to save the world's books — one word at a time.

Illiterati is a real-time, co-operative word game in which players work together to form words and bind books. Each player starts the game with five letter tiles and a red torched book that shows a condition that player must achieve to restore that book, e.g. using 8+ tiles with at least 3 green symbols, create words that are all animals. A library of three random tiles is placed in the center of the table. The game takes place in three-minute rounds, and before the round begins each player draw seven letter tiles from the draw bag.

Once the countdown begins, players can talk and trade letters as much as they want with one another and the library to try to achieve their goal. Once time ends, if the library contains too many letters — and this threshold is based on your difficulty level — then you trigger a burn event. Flip all of these letters face down, then remove one of them from the game, then discard excess letters to the discard bag. If you burn too many letters, you lose the game. If you didn't burn any letters and you've completed your goal, flip your red book face down and draw a blue waterlogged book to give yourself a new goal.

At the end of the round, draw an illiterati villain card and resolve its effect. If you've drawn this villain previously — and the deck contains five copies of five villains — then all of the previous effects from this villain also resolve in a chain attack from newest to oldest. Villain attacks often strip letters from words, which means you'll need to create new words with what's left during the next round to avoid burning another letter.

Once all players have completed two books — or three or four depending on your difficulty level — draw one more book, the Final Chapter, with all players needing to complete this challenge in the same round, e.g., using 12+ tiles, create words in which all of your vowels are the same color. If all players meet this goal during the same round, you win; if even one person fails, another villain attacks, then you draw new tiles to start another round. You can discard and redraw up to seven tiles at the start of a round, but you must draw a second illiterati villain card that round — and if the villain deck runs out, you lose.

boardgame.name: Sixth World Activity Book
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurp:

Draw, Chummer!

And color. And do puzzles. And bask in the wonders of the mighty Sixth World dystopia! If you need something to pass the time, if you’re feeling a little isolated, or if you just want to soak in the Shadowrun setting for a while, this activity book is for you! It has tons of classic black-and-white art you can bring to glorious, colorful life, word searches, a crossword, and a bunch of other puzzles. Pay whatever you want for the PDF, then dive in and pass the time!

The Sixth World Activity Book is for anyone who wants to pass sometime in one of the greatest fictional settings of all time—whether you’re a long-time veteran or just getting your first taste!

boardgame.name: Narrato
boardgame.description:
Narrato is a therapeutic boardgame where we invite players to enter the space between fiction and reality, between game and therapy.

Narrato takes players on an exploration hike through the many meaningful maps (domains) in their lives. It is a semi-cooperative game that you can play solo, with your partner, with (a) friend(s), with your family, with co-workers. The explorers (players) have total control on how to engage in the gameworld ('agency'). Under the supervision of a 'narrator', players explore a diversity of domains of meaning in close cooperation with each other. There are several domains of meaning in the game that can be chosen and are puzzled in a game board: neighbourhood, relationship, freetime, family, household, work, friends and school. In each domain you will face questions, exercises and challenges depending on the chosen mission. You gain 'join' points by doing missions and by engaging in the missions of other explorers.

The game ends after a fixed amount of gathered missions (depending on how long you want to play: between 1 hour and 3 hours) and the explorer with the most 'join' points (victory points), wins.

In a search for new ways to 'do psychotherapy', we offer in this board game an unseen constellation of play and therapy, where we let go of the necessary presence of a therapist in the therapeutic process. Narrato is a board game that has it's inspiration from concepts within the narrative psychotherapy and systemic psychotherapy. In an atmosphere of fun and connection, players remember not only rich stories but they also write new ones with the playing of Narrato. Players can get connected in surprising ways and through the specific design of the game. We expect new kinds of experiences for themselves, their partner, their family, friends and other meaningful persons in life. Increasing each other's sense of influence is rewarded ('relational agency’) through 'join' points.

boardgame.name: Immortal Festival
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

There’s a faint, pleasant scent on the breeze and the word “ambrosia” on your tongue. You inhale sharply and the world seems cleaner, brighter. It’s early morning in Mirna, and the sun rising over the water carries with it a new luster and a deep calm. From your hilltop vantage, you can see the crowd approaching the shore as it recedes and divides as if cut with a butter knife, making way for the goddess of the waters to stride ashore and into the arms of her people.

Even from here, you can sense her radiance and power, and you feel its blessing wash over your heart. A dozen of the people from the shore levitate and soar over the ocean, over the town, over you. A dazzling array of colors shine atop the buildings through every soul. A loud, booming song erupts through the air, and the most joyful cheer you’ve ever felt crosses the hills and rolls across the land. The Festival has begun.

IMMORTAL FESTIVAL is an eight-page sidequest zine designed to be dropped into the tabletop roleplaying game of your choice. It contains 20 divine domains, 20 supernatural powers, and 20 mundane tasks that are maybe not totally 100% worth wasting your limited immortality on.

boardgame.name: Swipe
boardgame.description:
Dating apps are full of unknown people, and until we get to know them better, we have stereotypical thinking, right? How can you choose a person, having only their appearance and just a little bit of info about personality? Imagine there is a fragile charming girl and a handsome athlete guy in front of you — which of them looks so reliable that you would take him or her with you to the ISS? What if the girl spoils the series but is a jack-of-all-trades, and the guy is the passive-aggressive mom's friend's son? What will you do: swipe right or ignore?

Swipe is a party game with extremely simple rules. At the start of a round, one player becomes the leader and closes their eyes. Another player draws two character cards from the deck and places them in slots 1 and 2 in the plastic organizer to make them easy to see, then draws an action card from the deck and places it between these characters. Each player other than the leader receives a goal card that shows either 1 or 2 — and your job is to make the leader pick that character so that you score 1 point.

On your turn, give characters trait cards — whether positive or negative — by playing them from your hand. The leader then chooses the character to whom they will apply the action drawn at the beginning of the round: to kill, to marry, to have sex with, etc. All the players whose character was chosen receive 1 point.

Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

listing.notes: Title: Swipe Publisher: Cosmodrome Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Raiders of the Serpent Sea Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Raiders of the Serpent Sea is an epic fantasy campaign for the fifth edition of the world's greatest roleplaying game. It introduces Grimnir, a new campaign setting inspired by Norse myth that can be connected to any other campaign world, but one with a special link to Thylea (the lost continent from Odyssey of the Dragonlords).

The World of Grimnir. Introduces the world, its origins, and major historical events. Learn about the cursed gods known as the Stone Court, the wealthy kingdoms that threaten the raiders, and the power of sacrifice.


New Class Archetypes. Includes ranger, bard, and wizard archetypes that help bring to life the various raider clans.
New Player Races. Includes rules for playing the Wicker and Tallfolk.
Glory! Introduces a new glory system fueling your character's ability to boast to overwhelm adversaries.
All Backgrounds are Epic. Includes four epic backgrounds for players to choose from. These backgrounds create additional motivations for your hero and weave their personal stories into the core campaign.

boardgame.name: Capstone Spells
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each of the following spells are class-specific, meaning that only those of that spell’s specific class can learn it and cast it. These spells cannot be learned through the bard’s Magical Secrets feature or any other features or traits or effects.

Artificer - Automaton
Bard - Encore
Cleric - Miracle
Druid - Summon Primordials
Paladin - Aura of Salvation
Ranger - Ravager's Mark
Sorcerer - Havoc Storm
Warlock - Miasma of Kurn
Wizard - Wizard's Tower

boardgame.name: The Tor of Bones
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Low-Level Fantasy Adventure for Player Levels 2 to Intended for Use with Most Fantasy Roleplaying Games

The druidic Necropolis of Darragh was built inside a mountain peak known as The Tor of Bones.
It was destroyed by a terrible storm ages ago and abandoned, but its burial vaults remained.
These days it is overrun by wandering creatures and the angry dead the druids left behind.

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am happy to announce the release of the tenth adventure in my Old School Series, THE TOR OF BONES! This undead themed one-shot scenario is intended for 4 to 6 novice adventurers of levels 2 to 4. The adventure in this scenario takes place within the mountains near the hill dwarf village of Ben Gabha, in the Fortis province in the nation state of The Imperium. In this scenario your treasure-hunting players will be exploring a two-level dungeon delve full of the angry and resentful spirits of ancient druids, whose once noble souls have, sadly, become corrupted over the eons. Their rage having transformed them into vile undead, they care nothing for the life force they once cherished and now seek only to extinguish life. If your players can put these fiends to rest, their forgotten treasures are ripe for the taking!

Synopsis: Within a prominent peak the ancient druids founded a large underground complex, built above the gravesite of one of the greatest of their order, the Grandmaster Arten Darragh. This place became one of their most holy shrines, known to the druids as the Necropolis of Darragh. It was abandoned after becoming heavily flooded in terrible storms brought on by cataclysmic events long ago, but its burial vaults remain. These days it is overrun by wandering creatures who have found their way inside and the dead buried beneath it, some of whom have grown angry and discontented over the eons.

The common folk who later settled this area have mostly forgotten about the druids who once shepherded this land, and their stronghold. Their folk tales speak of an ancient place of power high in the mountains, but they have generally avoided the place out of superstition and fear. Over the years the locals came to call this place the Tor of Bones, and legends about it grew, claiming the tor is a place of evil and all those who enter risk both their lives and their eternal souls. Luckily, this means its treasure is likely to be undisturbed! For in addition to being a burial place for their honoured dead, the nature priests also used the complex as a vault for storing their knowledge and treasures.

Intrigued by the promise of untapped riches, your group has decided to test your mettle beneath the tor. Good luck!
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Damnlands
boardgame.description:
Damnlands :a long time ago, Great Old Ones breached into our world and wrecked chaos and disasters. Humanity managed to survive by combining magic and science, building grate city fortresses. Now after 500 years the Great Old Ones are trying to breach again. A group of exceptional investigators adventurers must break their plans and discover whereabouts of their Avatars (Nemesis) to destroy them...

Damnlands is a turn based, action-selection, rss management, adventure, co-op, variable player powers game, from 1 to 5 players.

On their turn, players will upgrade their characters with cards, resolve skill tests on location and fight minions. Good cooperation is required to ensure success!

Players activate their skills icons with cubes and move on a board.

The game ends if Nemesis track reach the end. Players win when they found and destroy Nemesis in combat.

boardgame.name: Extraordinary Places
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Extraordinary Places is a great resource for Players and DMs to "see" more of fantasy realms.

What's in Extrordinary Places?

Illustrations and maps of 10 places of interest which are are very handy for any GM who would like to incorporate unusual locations during game sessions.

Each place consists of two parts. The first is notebook for DM and consists of sized maps and illustrations of each location mentioned above.

The second part is a set of handouts ( a map (with and without Grid) and an illustration of each location) which can be easily printed or presented to players during a session, in order to enrich the locale's description and create a more precise presentation.

boardgame.name: Battle Blocks: Sengoku
boardgame.description:
Play out fast and simple battles during the Sengoku period in Japan! Streamlined and simple rules allow for games to be played in 20-30 minutes. Using home made blocks, and simple terrain (or no terrain at all!) as well as the included unit counters allows players to quickly construct an attractive looking game which can be taken almost anywhere.

Each turn the players roll a die to determine initiative for the round. Play then proceeds into the command phase where players spend action points on moving their blocks around on the board. The game ends when one player defeats the other by destroying 4 of their opponent's blocks.

Players can use 3D terrain, hand drawn maps, or just a kitchen table to play on. The goal of the design is so make wargaming as easy and simple as possible to get into. The use of coloured blocks and action dice also means the transition to wargaming is made easier for those who currently only play traditional board and counter games.

Movement is regulated in inches using tape measures or home made measuring sticks and the rules of the game fit onto a single side of A4.

boardgame.name: ¿Qué País Soy?: Europa
boardgame.description:
Trivial type game, with questions and challenges about the 50 Eurasian countries.

The game consists of 100 cards, 1 dice and 100 videos on YouTube.
Capital, language, currency and other questions about countries are what you will have to get right to accumulate cards and beat your rivals. The player with the highest number of cards wins the game.

The game has questions in QR codes that link to videos in which the location, anthem and images of a country will appear that you will have to get right before a countdown ends.


Juego tipo trivial, con preguntas y retos sobre los 50 países euroasiáticos.
El juego está formado por 100 cartas, 1 dado y 100 vídeos en Youtube.
Capital, idioma, moneda y otras preguntas sobre países son las que tendrás que acertar para ir acumulando cartas y ganar a tus rivales.
El juego tiene preguntas en códigos QR que enlazan con vídeos en los que te aparecerá la ubicación, himno e imágenes de un país que tendrás que acertar antes que finalice una cuenta atrás.

boardgame.name: Magic Maze: Zwischengeschosse
boardgame.description: Promo tiles A, B and C to expand the mall. None of these tiles require the expansion.

boardgame.name: Splintered Lands
boardgame.description:
Splintered Lands is a post-apocalypse-themed expandable deck-building game from Civil Dawn Games. Players take on the role of an enclave governor who must lead their people in a fight for survival using a brand new base-defense tactical deck-building game mechanic.

Somehow, you have cobbled together a band of basic fighting men and women to help you survive in the inhospitable wasteland you call home. However, you’ve noticed another group of survivors competing for resources in your area. If you are going to survive for long, you are going to need to spend your ever-dwindling resources to convince new and capable people to join you in the constant struggle...but finding them can be just as difficult as convincing them to come back with you.

Players take turns attacking their opponent, fortifying their enclave, and searching the Dunes to acquire new and powerful characters to join their fight. Defeat your opponent by crippling their authority, and do it quickly -- your opponent will only grow stronger the longer you let them live. Unfortunately, they know it, too.

Each player starts the game with an 11 card deck. Then players choose which factions they want to be represented. Combine your favorite three factions to create the six card Dunes deck. This is where you will find powerful allies to join your enclave. On their turn, players play cards, pick cards, and arrange/navigate cards on their side. The game ends when one player has had their Authority (life) reduced to 0 due to actions happening in the game. A player wins by reducing their opponents Authority (life) to 0 or below.

Along with the four starting factions, Splintered Lands has five expansions already planned out. Each expansion contains two new factions, plus exclusive bonus content. These unique boosters create new ways to engage with the world of Splintered Lands, giving players optional new ways to defeat their opponents, new and interesting mechanics to discover, and unusual aberrant creatures to defend with or against.

boardgame.name: Literatio
boardgame.description:
A new game for people who like word games, crosswords and other educational, challenging family friendly games.

Literatio is a game of word creation where 2 to 5 players build words from cards drawn with cards used from preceding players’ words to ultimately achieve the highest score. A player’s word is scored by the numeric value of each letter plus the total number of cards used. Each word played after the first must contain at least one card from the previous word and at least one card from their hand. A fast, portable word making game that's also fun as a solitaire game.

Literatio comes in a cloth draw-string bag containing 100 small laminated letter cards, instructions, pencil, and score sheets.

Player One builds as high a scoring word as he can. For example, 8 points for the total of the numerical values of the letters
plus 6 points for the number of cards used.

Player Two discards one card from Player One's word into a used letter pool and rearranges the remaining letters while adding at least one of his own to make a new word. Play continues until all cards have been drawn and one of the players has used all of his cards or until all possible words are played. The value of the
unused cards that players are unable to play are subtracted from their scores.

The player with the highest score wins! Players may use a timer if desired.

boardgame.name: Sector
boardgame.description:
WINNER of Best Innovative Mechanic in the 10th Roll and Write Design Contest
RUNNER UP in Best Written Rules, Best Game Sheet and Best Multiplayer Game

A FREE One Page low ink Print And Play game of search and rescue in the depths of space.

You can’t remember how long you have searched but somehow you have kept going. Your ship just barely holding together you find yourself dazed and adrift in uncharted Space. You will have to scrape together all the resources you can to survive and maybe, at long last just maybe, find The Lost Pilot.

Accompanied by a unique soundtrack (linked by QR code on the playing map) and using just a couple of dice and some coloured pens, one to three players must each navigate this SECTOR of space in order to find their Lost Pilot and escape. But along the way they will have to face terrifying creatures, a crumbling ship and ultimately each other.

Link to a print copy of the Playing Map
https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/229289/sector-map

Link to a PDF copy of the rules
https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/229298/sector-rules

And the current development thread is here. It also contains everything you need to download and play and you’ll find a link to the Carpenter/Vangelis/Badalamenti inspired soundtrack there too.
https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/2727772/wip-search-and-resc...

boardgame.name: Secret and Cypher (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Secrets are valuable. Knowing the enemies’ orders can win a war. Knowing a competitor’s recipe for superior steel can make you rich. As long as there have been people, there have been secrets. The trouble is that sometimes you need to share these secrets, but only with a certain few.

That is why humans invented ways to hide secret messages, an art known as steganography. Of the many ways to hide messages one of the most popular is cryptography, the means of turning messages into unreadable blobs of text and then back.

Secret and Cypher includes:

A real world history of cryptography
Optional rules for encoding and decoding message
New equipment
1 new spell
3 magic items
1 new template
2 new monsters

boardgame.name: Secret and Cypher (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Secrets are valuable. Knowing the enemies’ orders can win a war. Knowing a competitor’s recipe for superior steel can make you rich. As long as there have been people, there have been secrets. The trouble is that sometimes you need to share these secrets, but only with a certain few.

That is why humans invented ways to hide secret messages, an art known as steganography. Of the many ways to hide messages one of the most popular is cryptography, the means of turning messages into unreadable blobs of text and then back.

Secret and Cypher includes:

A real world history of cryptography
Optional rules for encoding and decoding message
New equipment
1 new spell
3 magic items
1 new template
2 new monsters

boardgame.name: Secret and Cypher (SW)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Secrets are valuable. Knowing the enemies’ orders can win a war. Knowing a competitor’s recipe for superior steel can make you rich. As long as there have been people, there have been secrets. The trouble is that sometimes you need to share these secrets, but only with a certain few.

That is why humans invented ways to hide secret messages, an art known as steganography. Of the many ways to hide messages one of the most popular is cryptography, the means of turning messages into unreadable blobs of text and then back.

Secret and Cypher includes:

A real world history of cryptography
Optional rules for encoding and decoding message
New equipment
1 new power
2 magic items
3 new monsters

boardgame.name: Catan Das Duell: Sonderkarte Herberge
Rivals for Catan: Hostel Scenario
boardgame.description:
This is a free official print & play scenario released during the 2020 pandemic.

From the scenario:
All of us are longing for eateries, hotels, and B & Bs to reopen. Fortunately, there are still hostels on Catan that offer traveling merchants excellent room and board. You can use these special hostel cards as an addition to the Rivals for CATAN™
introductory game and when playing the theme games.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Free PnP during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic (Asmodee)

listing.notes:
first Edition, German version: Herberge, © 2020 by Kosmos
packed in a ZIP bag
Shipping costs see informations below.
Payment via PayPal or bank transfer. If you pay via PayPal, please use the button “Send to friends abroad”, then there are no fees. ... Thanks!!
Please verify your shipping address before ordering or paying with PayPal. If your address contains non-Latin characters please include it in Latin script, too.
We offer in our "Modern Second-Hand-Games-Shop" on our private homepage www.alte-spiele.de/antiquar.html more than 4.000 other games: older one, newer one, rare one and little known one. The offer consists of titles since the 1970s and mainly in German-speaking. Just look once over with us.

boardgame.name: The Young and the Brave
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Players take on the roles of supernaturally gifted children fighting an invisible war against evil creature who would see humanity wiped off the earth.

The game was inspired by the mythologies of children, the stories kids tell each other that craft beliefs ignored by adults. It draws upon urban legends, popular media, and memories of childhood to flesh out the world in which the game is played.

The Young and the Brave tries to maintain some of the complexity of popular role-playing games such as Dungeons and Dragons or Pathfinder, while remaining accessible to new players and those who don’t want to spend too much time dealing with rules. The goal of the game throughout the design process has been to keep things fairly simple without sacrificing game mechanics.

boardgame.name: Carcassonne: Demonstration
boardgame.description:
Inspired by the medieval fortress in southern France of the same name, Carcassonne is a tile-laying game in which players fill in the countryside around the fortified city. Players choose from tiles that depict cities, roads, monasteries, and fields; each new tile placed creates an ever-expanding board. Compete to claim these features and score the most points to win!

This print and play demonstration game has 48 tiles instead of 72 and smaller tiles. It is played with 5 instead of 7 meeples (not included).
It also comes with a printable edition of the scoreboard. Released by Asmodee.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Free PnP during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic (Asmodee)

boardgame.name: Toast
boardgame.description:
Toast is a handmade scrambled word game where players race to form words of 4 or more letters and collect the most tiles by the end of the game. Seven tiles are face-up on the table, and the first player to see a word of 4+ letters among them calls it out, collects those letters, and replaces them from the draw pile. After all tiles are flipped and no more words can be made, the player with the most tiles wins.

Toast includes a drawstring fabric bag containing 131 individually word burned tiles and game directions. The tiles are approximately 1"x 1", consisting of:
- 125 letter tiles.
- 3 buttered toast tiles, which can count as any letter.
- 3 burnt toast tiles, which give the players who draw them -4 points each.

boardgame.name: An Academic Problem
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mage Academy is famous throughout the world. Few people are invited to visit, and yet here you are. But people are rushing all over, and something doesn't seem right...

An Academic Problem can be used stand-alone or as part of the Free City of Raiderspoint Adventure Tome (AT-3 plus ONA-9 through ONA-12)

boardgame.name: Comes Chaos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

COMES CHAOS is a campaign setting designed for use with the B/X fantasy adventure game (and compatible retro-clones). It contains the information needed to transform your home campaign into a chaotic hellscape populated with mutants and demons, dark sorcery and depraved cultists.

The book contains new ways to use old character classes. It contains dozens of spells of dark sorcery. More than 100 mutations and "gifts" of the dark powers. New combat options. Scores of monstrous foes and demons. More than 50 unholy magic items. Rules for creating chaotic wastelands, rules for corrupting player characters, rules for demons and cultists and for running a setting of ever encroaching chaos and the heroes that struggle against its rising tide. Information on running a villainous campaign for aspiring champions of evil, as well as guidelines for redeeming those unfortunates who fall to darkness.

Whether you're looking for a unifying theme for your fantasy adventure game, or simply want to spice up your campaign with demonic possession and vile enchantments, COMES CHAOS has plenty of demented ideas for your enjoyment.

boardgame.name: Build Word Challenge
boardgame.description:
The Build Word Challenge deck is a game system with which many word games can be played. The deck has 2 copies of each consonant, 4 copies of each vowel, and 2 star (wild) cards. The letter cards are also numbered 1-26 in alphabetical order, and the star card is 27. The letters and star are printed in 4 colors (red, blue, green, black), 2 on each card. The numbers and colors can be used for different games, change a game’s difficulty, and resolve ties.

The main Build Word Challenge game deals 7 cards to each player, and they each write down all the words they can find among them; then they pass their hand to the left and do the same with the new hand. This is repeated until each player has examined each hand, and then everyone scores all the words they found; highest score wins.

The rules booklet includes rules for word games based on many other popular games:

BWC Canasta
BWC Concentration
BWC Cribbage
BWC Gin Rummy
BWC Go Fish
BWC Pass the Deck
BWC Poker
BWC Rack-O
BWC Scrabble
BWC Seven
BWC Solitaire (5 different games)
BWC Spoons
BWC Trash
BWC UNO
BWC War
BWC 2Plus
BWC 56 Sticks
BWC 900 Rummy

boardgame.name: Crews of Eridanus
boardgame.description:
"Crews of Eridanus" is a science fiction-themed board game of exploration and adventure for 1–6 players. Playing time is normally 2 hours.

Each player represents the Captain of a small in-system spacecraft that has been selected by the authorities to help get the system economy and travel back to normal. As a Captain, you’ll need to recruit a crew and good crews don’t come cheap. Crews of Eridanus is an open world and there are a number of ways to earn credits: carrying passengers, trading cargoes, mining, exploring wrecks and hunting pirates. All players start with the same size of crew, ship and resources, but they are free to pursue whatever strategy they think best. Each player builds a unique tableau consisting of different crew members and ship modifications.

The game is played over a series of rounds, with each player taking their respective turn. A player can usually take 3 actions per turn.

The game starts in a pirate phase, where pirate ships occupy a number of locations on the map. If most of the pirates are destroyed, then the game shifts to a normal phase. Finally, the game enters an end phase after a pre-determined number of rounds have been played and a boss appears.

There are multiple ways to defeat the boss, but if it is not dealt with quickly then all of the players will lose. If the players are successful in stopping the boss, whoever has the most Victory Points is the winner.

boardgame.name: BIO
boardgame.description:
Bio takes the color/ card type matching mechanic we all know and love and turns it into an adrenaline-fueled fight for your life! Push, Run, Hide, and Kill your way through an endless horde of zombies in an attempt to be the first to escape the facility.

Players draw cards using a modified UNO game mechanic and try to escape before the deck runs out. Some cards can turn players into Zombies. When this happens, players still try to escape.

The first human player to get rid of all their cards (escapes), wins. Alternatively, a zombie player must escape before the last human player dies.

As part of an elite biological threat elimination squad, you find yourself deep in the heart of an underground military complex known to be in possession of a deadly new chemical weapon. It quickly becomes clear things are far worse than expected when buried in the thick darkness of the subterranean halls you discover actual zombies! The deafening roar of automatic gunfire erupts as you pump round after round into the horde, filling the narrow corridors with muzzle flashes and gore. As the sprinting river of gnashing teeth and rotting flesh pours out of the dark, you realize the futility of your defense and turn back toward the exit. Overwhelmed and starving for ammo the mission priority shifts from completion.. to survival.

Can you escape this nightmare? Or will you become part of it?

boardgame.name: Caverna: The Cave Farmers – Dwarf Weapon Dials
boardgame.description:
These are a set of ten (10) dwarf weapon dials to replace Caverna's system of tracking dwarf weapon levels, which use cardboard tokens.

The game's cardboard tokens track the dwarf's weapon level by placing the correct numbered token on top of the dwarf. These dials replace this system entirely. You no longer must fiddle with the cardboard tokens during each adventure, looking for the correct new number every time. Instead, simply place your dwarf in the dial when he goes on his first adventure. Then enjoy dialing your dwarf to his new more powerful level as needed, with style and ease! The tiles are multicolored plastic. Thick and durable.

boardgame.name: אלפא (Alpha)
boardgame.description:
In Alpha, players try to lose their cards as quickly as possible, by matching colours or Hebrew letters. Some power cards mix up the gameplay to add some strategy.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Liar Liar: The Game of Truths and Lies
boardgame.description:
A Hilarious Party Game for all ages. Who's the best LIAR in your friend group?

Each round players share a short, personal statement relating to one of their topic cards. If you get the secret role of LIAR, you have to lie! Everybody else has to tell the truth. You win by identifying the liar, and by tricking your friends into thinking YOU are the liar.

The player who wins the most rounds, wins the game.

boardgame.name: HINT Promo
boardgame.description:
HINT is about hinting to your team-mates what YOU know. You can hint by talking, drawing, miming or humming. The better you are at hinting, the faster you can advance. But be careful about wild guesses, because there are things you are NOT allowed to guess. Get ready to play the #1 party game in Scandinavia.

—description from the publisher

Promotional game has 20 cards.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Free PnP during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic (Asmodee)

boardgame.name: Het IQ Spel
boardgame.description:
Solve puzzles and questions in 5 categories: language, math, spatial visualization, logic, general knowledge. Get enough right in each category before anyone else to win.

—user summary

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – Irregulars
boardgame.description:
Fall of 3134. After decades of peace and prosperity, interstellar communications broke down two years ago, and conflict is sweeping through the Republic of the Sphere.

As ancient hatreds and rivalries rear their ugly heads, people who have only known war through history books are suddenly thrust into the dark maelstrom of combat. Splinter factions have arisen, aligning themselves with fealties long thought forgotten, and stalking each other on Republic worlds like jackals. Often lacking military-grade equipment, these groups and defending militias deploy SecurityMechs, Support Vehicles, or even modified civilian machinery in their desperate struggle to prevail.

Technical Readout: Irregulars unveils the weapons deployed during the chaos after Gray Monday when paramilitaries warred in the Republic’s outer Prefectures. Technical Readout: Irregulars debuts the production and custom machines used by splinter factions in 3132 and afterward. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 25 new IndustrialMech MODs, Security- and MilitiaMechs, support vehicles, and their variants ready for play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Brick & Mortar: Promo Starting Stores
boardgame.description: Pack of 2 new starting stores that provide early access to the jewelry and art markets. Use these alongside the existing starting stores to add more variability to the early rounds of the game. Kickstarter promo

boardgame.name: Schinderhannes 1803
boardgame.description:
Soonwald 1802 - Schinderhannes the robber is on the run.

The players try to find out where Schinderhannes committed which crime. To do this, follow the various instructions on the info cards. Reference markers are placed on the possible locations and help with research.

Using the exclusion principle, indicator markers can gradually be removed again until a crime has been precisely identified for a location.

The players are rewarded the more information they provide.

The game ends when there is a crime disc on each town and thus all offenses and their locations have been determined.

The player with the most points wins.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Thinker games for one player (Clicker Spiele)

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 1bis 2 Spieldauer: keine Angabe Altersempfehlung: 10+
DENKERSPIEL - SCHINDERHANNES 1803 Das zweite Spiel der Reihe der Denkerspiele ist nun lieferbar. Anspruchsvolle Logikspiele für einen Spieler mit historischem Hintergrund und toller Grafik. Schinderhannes 1803 besteht aus einem Kartensatz mit 76 Karten, einem Notizblock und einem Bleistift sowie einer ausführlichen Spielregel. Es gibt insgesamt 18 Rätsel mit unterschiedlichem Schwierigkeitsgrad. Logiklevel: 3 von 5
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE,EN

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 59 - Oct 2021)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
October 2021

Oltréé

boardgame.name: Nightmare at the Rockport Caverns
boardgame.description:
Nightmare at the Rockport is a roll and write game where you and a friend are spelunkers exploring the caverns. While in the caverns, an earthquake hits the area and catastrophic geologic nightmare ensues. Rock slides block pathways and the water begins to rise from the lowest point of the caverns. To make matters worse, in all the confusion, your friend gets injured and separated from you in the caverns. Your goal is to find your injured friend and escape out of the caverns before the water overtakes you. If you run out of Life points, unable to escape the caverns, or you are overtaken by the rising waters, you lose!

Each turn you will roll for two rock slides. Next, you will raise the water level in the caverns. You will then take two actions to either move, climb, dig. After completing your actions, you will roll for an event. Two of these can be beneficial ... but don't get your hopes up! The event die can really thwart your effort to get out of the caverns.

Once you get to close enough, you will call out to your friend and the location of your friend will be revealed. You will then trudge your way through the caverns to reconnect and escape out of the caverns.

boardgame.name: Wicker Park
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

If the fire dies, we die.

Wicker Park is a district of The City, a neighborhood of fire and ash. An ever-burning bonfire sits at the center of the district. Some say that if the bonfire goes out, the district goes with it...

This is a setting supplement for the Slayers RPG. The entire district fits on a single sheet of letter paper, folded as a tri-fold pamphlet. Inside you'll find:


Description of a district that is a powder keg ready to explode
Two factions at war with one another
NPCs that will attempt to lure the Slayers to their side
Rumors to entice the Slayers into the district, and unravel its secrets
Statblock for a beast drawn to the flames of war in Wicker Park: The Mothman

boardgame.name: Chance Meetings
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Chance Meetings is a set of location-based travel encounters compatible with Mausritter. Encounters for the coast, the road, and the woods are included. Each encounter is presented with separate player-facing and GM-facing information to facilitate quick use at the table.

boardgame.name: #_Hashtag
boardgame.description:
In this Roll & Write game, you roll 2 dice each turn and record the result of one in your sheet (a small paper with 9 boxes like a Hashtag). The other die is available for the player to your right. But only in the 4 boxes upper-left of this matrix, because the last column and the last row you must record the result of a mathematical operation from preceding boxes (addition or subtraction). These are the double boxes.

When you have a double box, you can choose the result of two dice thrown by any player and score it in your sheet.

The first player who mark his 5 double boxes first will be the winner, and the game ends.

boardgame.name: Dinosaur Exhibit
boardgame.description:
Welcome museum curators! A Spinosaurus skeleton has just been discovered in your area, and all the museums want it for their dinosaur exhibits. As a curator, you must roll for curation tools, expand your exhibit areas, manage storage rooms, and create impressive layouts of fossils in your dinosaur exhibit. The museum with the most curation points will receive the Spinosaurus skeleton for display.

Players take turns rolling the curation dice, choosing their tools and shading their map, using pillar tokens, and displaying dinosaur fossils to create the best dinosaur exhibit. Place your fossil tiles just right to create more bonuses to increase your curation points score.

boardgame.name: Novae
boardgame.description:
publisher blub

The second module for Eclipse is here! Check out Novae, the newest enemy faction. New enemies to fight, new challenges to the star map, and advice on how to run an especially dangerous strike against them!

boardgame.name: Dusk
boardgame.description:
publisher blub

The third module for the Eclipse season pass has arrived! Three new classes of Beacon, known as Shades, are now available to the players. Walk the line between Light and Dark, sitting in the shadowy Dusk. All three classes are based on concepts of entropy, and bring a new way to play LIGHT with a new resource!

boardgame.name: Lunar Base: Kickstarter Limited Edition Extra Cards
boardgame.description:
A Kickstarter-exclusive set of 12 extra cards for Lunar Base.


4 Stations (Braun, Kafka, Korolev, Tipu)
8 Influences (Blood Moon, Credit Reform, Free Market, Longevity, Metamorphosis, Moonstone Cops, Transparency, Welfare)
1 Descriptive card (not playable)


just for the 2078 backers.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Wicked Fate
boardgame.description:
Fantasy Adventure Powered by Fate

The Reign of Men faces an age of change. Will it find a new path or fall to ruin? Only the heroes of Estevere can decide…

In 2013, John Wick reinvented ten classic fantasy races through the world of Estevere, a unique Pathfinder setting that broke Kickstarter records and expanded what it meant to play elves, humans, orks, gnomes, kobolds, and more. Now, Magpie Games brings you a full Fate Core conversion for that world, allowing players and GMs to explore Estevere using the award-winning Fate Core system for the first time!

Wicked Fate is a fantasy supplement for Fate Core that gives you all you need to bring the world of Estevere to life, including:


A complete introduction to the world of Estevere, a land of conflict filled with opportunities to define the coming age.


Fate Core templates for John Wick’s reinvention of ten fantasy races featuring elves, humans, orks, gnolls, kobolds, and more.

Dozens of new aspects and stunts that bring the reimagined races to life in Fate Core beyond racial bonuses or feats.
A modified skill list for fantasy adventuring in Estevere that includes Command, an additional social skill for Fate Core.
A new magic system for Fate Core that allows players to create custom effects on the fly without spell lists or mana pools.


Wicked Fate requires three to five players, some Fate dice, a few tokens, and Fate Core System (available free online) to play.

The Fate of Estevere Is In Your Hands!

(Publisher Blurb)

boardgame.name: Lightfall
boardgame.description:
publisher blub

The final module of Eclipse is here! Lightfall is the exciting defense of the Lighthouse, the home of humanity and the Beacons. What will this last stand look like? How will your campaign end? Find out with Lightfall.

boardgame.name: Il dono del Nilo
Playing Last
boardgame.description:
Two players take turns in covering the Nile valley with silt.

The chessboard has 7 x 7 squares. On their turn, the player places a tile that covers two adjacent squares on the board. Tiles cannot be placed on top one another.

If the player is unable to lay down a tile, the game ends and he loses the game.

This board game is a themed version of a traditional paper & pencil games called Playing Last.

—description by the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #7.

boardgame.name: Latvijas Neatkarības Karš 1918-1920
boardgame.description:
On November 18th 1918 Latvian Republic declared independence. But Latvians still had to fight for their independence and had to free their territory from the enemy forces.

In this co-op wargame players control Latvian and their allied forces, and fight for the freedom of Latvia.
Players will recruit army units, fight battles, supply their forces and help wounded units.
Historical figures like Kārlis Ulmanis, Oskars Kalpaks and others will assist players in a form of cards.

The game has three scenarios, each covering a period of the war.

Each scenario has their own winning condition and loosing condition. Usually Latvian forces need to gain control of certain territories and hold on to them till the end of game.

Game is driven by a cooperative deck building. Players draw and play cards from a common deck, that they build up together.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 2 gegen 20
boardgame.description:
One player gets 2 red pieces, the other 20 yellow ones. The red player has to defend his 9 red places that the yellow player wants to occupy. The red player must jump over yellow pieces and remove them, otherwise he loses a piece. The yellow player may only move his pieces forward or sideways. The yellow player wins if he can occupy all 9 red squares, or the red player has no piece left. The red player wins when he has reduced the yellow player to 8 pieces.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Durch die Wildnis
boardgame.description:
The game is a safari trip to Africa. Graphics and logo style indicate pre-1934 Germany.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 80 wins the game. On some spaces, events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Quak quak
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 70 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the frogs.

Published in Auerbachs Deutscher Kinderkalender 1926 edition.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

boardgame.name: M-Space (Spanish Compilation)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explora las estrellas con M-SPACE. Encuentra planetas no cartografiados al borde de un horizonte de sucesos. Descubre tecnología alienígena, olvidada en el tiempo. O enfréntate a villanos clásicos de la ciencia ficción como imperios galácticos corruptos o las más despiadadas corporaciones.

M-SPACE incluye:

Personajes únicos y distintivos motivados por sus fuertes pasiones.
Diseño modular de naves estelares y un sistema de combate rápido y creativo.
Reglas para crear alienígenas creíbles, con sus mundos y culturas.
M-SPACE es un juego de rol basado en Mythras. Solo necesitas este libro para jugar.

La presente edición en castellano de M-SPACE incluye tanto el contenido del libro básico como del M-SPACE Companion publicado posteriormente y escrito por Scott Crowder y Clarence Redd.

boardgame.name: Speed Round 5E: A Guide to Streamlining Remote Tabletop Games
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Moving from a live tabletop to a virtual online setting requires patience and, at least initially, some effort, and a bit of advance preparation will pay off during the game session. This publication enhances the flow of play in D&D 5E by reducing administrative overhead and shifting the spotlight away from the rules and back to the characters with an eye toward sustaining interest and engagement.

Speed Round includes mechanical adjustments to combat, characters, spells and spellcasting, and monsters — to include a mathematically-sound method for creating monster clusters — that are designed to streamline online play and make it quicker, easier, and more enjoyable. It helps to make online gaming smoother, quicker, and more pleasant with tips and guidance on teleconferencing; use of virtual tabletops and features associated with them like windows where maps can be displayed; and preparing for, running, and wrapping up sessions. It is lavishly illustrated and includes more than 100 images by noted fantasy artist Amanda Kahl.

Skirmisher Publishing and its development group have been gaming virtually online for nearly a decade and established through their experiences the best practices that have been distilled into the contents of this guidebook. Primary author Octavius Knorr has a background in science and management, has a Ph.D. in geology, and has extensive experience with teleconferencing, arranging virtual gatherings, and developing online protocols.

Speed Round speeds up “roll-play” to make more time for “role-play.”

boardgame.name: Garon Bluffs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A storm has moved through the coastal town of Habis and your departure has been put on hold. Much to your surprise, a pirate has washed ashore signaling more to follow?

The scenario was designed for a quartet of first level PCs. This offering was a fantastic time for the Murder Hobo Inc. podcast show on Twitch.

boardgame.name: Ozean-Fliegerspiel
boardgame.description:
A game recreating the Trans-Atlantic flights of Lindbergh (1927) and Köhl (1928). There are four different ways to play this game.

Line game (2-4 players): The players start in Germany or the USA. Each player has his own track. The players take turns to roll with 3 dice and move. Only rolls over 12 count. If a 13 or 14 are rolled, the player may move 1 space, at the roll of 15 or 16 he may move 2 spaces and so on. The first player to reach his destination wins the game.

Double game (2-6 players): The players form two teams. One team starts from Germany, the other from the USA. Movement is like in the line game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first Team to finish the journey wins the game.

Line or double game with the Novuma-die: The players use only the special die, which determines a movement of 1 or 2 spaces or 4 different events that hinder or benefit the pilots.

boardgame.name: Relics: A Game of Angels
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trapped on Earth. Surrounded by Enemies. Desperate for Answers.

God has gone and the Gates of Heaven have slammed shut, leaving angels and demons abandoned on the mortal world. Their powers, long trapped in physical objects, now begin to awaken and the cold war between the two sides erupts into a arms race to control all of creation. A desperate, brutal battle will be waged in the present on the secrets of the past.

Relics: A Game of Angels is a roleplaying game in a world inspired by Wings of Desire, Dogma and The Prophecy. Players take the role of angels who have lived on earth for hundreds or thousands of years. The unique memory system allows you to build an ever-growing backstory as you play, making you the unreliable narrator of your own past. Plus the simple Tarot-card system makes gameplay simple and fast, with characters made in just minutes.

It's a game like nothing else.

boardgame.name: An Angel's Guide to Las Vegas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Las Vegas doesn't sound like a town where you'd find angels. That's why it's the perfect place to hide, and begin their plans to build a new kingdom of God on earth. All the demons are dead, the mob's been run off and the shrimp is excellent. Jackpot, baby.

Except in Vegas, nothing is what it seems and nobody gets away clean...

This 26 page supplement includes everything you need to know to run a Relics game in Las Vegas. New Relics, new angelic personas and a public and secret history of the city are inside.

boardgame.name: By Demons Driven
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A phone call from a mysterious government agent leads to a corpse, a briefcase and a whole lot of trouble. Something is brewing out in the wild. Something big. Something dangerous. And it smells of sulphur.

By Demons Driven is the stand-alone sequel to The Devil's Own Luck which appeared in the Quick Start Guide. You can also use it to kickstart your own series here, and five pregenerated personas are included.

boardgame.name: The Reliquary (Vol. 1 - Feb/Mar 2019)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the thrill of the Kickstarter, fans of Relics made a short-lived fanzine. This is Issue One. It contains fiction, poetry, interviews and game ideas!

boardgame.name: Combo cards
boardgame.description:
Combo Cards - the Only Combined Playing and Word-building Cards. [From a 1934 Australian newspaper advert.]

The Combo deck is a traditional card deck with a letter in its center and below the suit symbol in the corners. Back in 1934, it might well have been the only such deck available.

The deck comes with rules for 3 games:

Lexical: A rummy game. Each player starts with 10 cards, and during their turn may either: discard a card to draw the top card of the draw or discard pile; lay a word down on the table form their hand; exchange a letter from the hand for one on the table (as long as it makes a valid word; or add one or more cards from the hand to an existing word to make a new word.

When one player empties their hand, each other player adds the points of the cards in their hand to their score. Face cards are 10 points, number cards have points equal to the number of spots, and the Joker (wild card) is 15 points. When someone reaches 100+ points the player with the lowest score wins.

Kittylex: The same as Lexical, except it scores by each player placing a chip in the kitty at the start of the round, and the winner claiming the kitty.

Combolex: The same as Lexical, except you may also lay down a flush or run of 5+ cards. You may not lay off cards on opponents' flushes or runs.

boardgame.name: Guardians of Fire: Temple of Destiny
boardgame.description:
The Temple of Yazd was sealed by the Priests of the Order. Hormozan and his brothers in faith ventured inside and were ambushed by the two mighty Arch Daevas: Akvan the first chosen of the Ahriman, God of darkness, and his bodyguard Savul.
Facing certain disaster, the only hope for the Hormozan was to call upon two goddesses: Mithra, the Divine Justice, and Anahita, Divine Protector.

The fate of this battle depends on you!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Inspirisles
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Experiencing visions of a mythical land throughout childhood, you are guided to a kingdom ruled by the fae. Responsible for a pact made long ago by your ancestors, Arthur & Guinevere Pendragon, you must now earn Belief and the respect of their gods to secure your ticket back home.

Inspirisles is a completely original all ages Tabletop RPG promoting storytelling, empathy and sign language with an emphasis on cooperation.


Play as teens gifted extraordinary powers.
Meet famous characters and fearsome creatures from Celtic folklore.
Work together to heal an ailing land and restore a fractured kingdom.
Learn British and American sign language as you cast spells, solve puzzles and battle monsters.

boardgame.name: Hexaquest: The Strategic Trivia Game
boardgame.description:
Hexaquest takes a completely new approach to the much beloved Trivia genre. It is an incredibly easy game to learn with endless ways of customizing the game to your liking and with an amazing deep strategic approach to becoming the victor.

1500 fun and challenging questions in 6 diverse categories will keep players engaged for a long time. Players in Hexaquest don’t have to rely on luck alone to decide how hard a question will be and in which category. Risky choices will reap big rewards and can potentially win the game. No board, no dice, simplicity at its best!

boardgame.name: Entromancy: Chaos Rifts
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Entromancy: Chaos Rifts, a recent attempted fusion between the synthetic renewable energy source, ceridium, and its organic counterpart, blue orichalcum, has resulted in both magic and technology going haywire. The San Francisco Bay Area is reeling from the chaos rifts that have emerged, requiring the three factions of Aurichome, NIGHT, and the Unaligned to join forces - or face annihilation.

boardgame.name: Word Gin
boardgame.description:
Gin Rummy with letters and words. Players have 10-card hands, and on their turn they draw and discard until they can use all their cards to form words of 3+ letters. The one who does this earns the points of all the cards in their hands, plus the points of all cards in opponents' hands that they cannot use to make their own words. The game continues until a determined total, e.g. 250 or 500 points.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Spire's End: Hildegard – Playmat
boardgame.description: 20 x 10 inch rubber playmat for Spire's End: Hildegard.

boardgame.name: Paris Connection: Hiawatha Connection
boardgame.description:
A new map for SNCF, Hiawatha Connection was designed by Anthony Fryer for Mainline magazine (Volume 1, Issue 1). It was included in the Collector's Edition of the magazine available through Kickstarter.

It features mountain hexes and rivers, both of which upon building into end the active player's turn. The game uses only five companies, each of which do not start on the map at the beginning of the game. The rules impose building restrictions that help to prevent wasted track builds by uninvested players.

boardgame.name: Six Entromancy Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need something quick just to fill in a journey, interrupt the characters' downtime, or just make life a little more...interesting for them?

Can your Entromancy characters deal with a police checkpoint, a mutated sewer creature, or a vault waiting to be robbed? What about a field of undead, a desert ambush, or a squad of very serious Special Forces soldiers?

Each encounter comes illustrated to give you some ideas of the set up, and a couple have simple maps where the layout is easier to explain visually. Each creature is illustrated with full stats for the Entromancy game.

boardgame.name: Trinkets from San Francisco Bay
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The need for interesting, weird items could arise while GMing Entromancy missions. In that case, simply crack open this file with your digitab and roll d100 on the list of 50 trinkets contained herein!

boardgame.name: Roll Hiawatha
boardgame.description:
Roll Hiawatha is a "Roll and Write" game that requires each player to cross off spaces on their card using a pair of communal dice to complete historic Hiawatha routes and score points. The game ends when at least one player has completed 3 or more of the historical Hiawatha Routes. A game takes about 30 minutes.

One player rolls 2d6 and all players may use these two dice to mark off one or more legal locations on their card. Each player chooses whether to use the dice singly or as a pair. Single dies may be used for Stations and Pullmans. Dice must be used as a pair in The Roundhouse, the Stock Market, and the Train Yard.

boardgame.name: Tranquility Today
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Фанзин, созданный в рамках мероприятия некого русскоязычного ролевого сообщества.

Предсnавляет собой имитацию журнала из будущего, в котором из-за проблем с энергетикой и связью печатные издания получили новую жизнь, использовать черную бумагу дешевле чем белую, а краски - роскошь для обложек и рекламы.

boardgame.name: Rustler - Murder Madness
boardgame.description:
More ways to create mayhem.

User Summary

boardgame.name: Land of Ice and Snow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The heroes must escape a Netherese ruin - before becoming part of the statuary.

A four-hour adventure for Tier 1 characters.

Optimized for APL 1.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Drive Our Ships to New Lands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As the heroes make their way to Good Mead, another powerful being of anow and frost - no, not Auril - entreats them for aid.

A four-hour adventure for Tier 1 characters.

Optimized for APL 2.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: We Calmed the Tides of War
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The heroes must find the mithral hand mirror in Good Mead, but they discover a town in turmoil - rife with murder, intrigue, and worse.

A four-hour adventure for Tier 1 characters.

Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Rebuild All Your Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The hand mirror obtained, the heroes must return to the Netherese ruin, all the while the Sisters of Lament making the journey potentially fatal.

A four-hour adventure for Tier 1 characters.

Optimized for APL 4.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Grasslands/Desert BFM Battlemat
boardgame.description:
A mega-sized 72” x 48", two-sided neoprene map:

Side A desert map containing 8 of the 12 maps from Map Pack: Deserts

"Badlands #2"
"Washout #1"
"Washout #2"
"Mines #2"
"AeroBase #1"
"AeroBase #2"
"Desert Runway"
"Oasis"


Side B grasslands map containing 8 of the 12 maps from Map Pack: Grasslands

"River CommCenter"
"Streams"
"Lakes"
"Open Terrain #2"
"Open Terrain #3"
"Rolling Hills #1"
"Rolling Hills #3"
"Rolling Hills #4"
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The September 17, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The September 24, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The October 1, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The October 8, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Fortified Beach Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need a new battlemap for your next seafairing campaign?

Fortified Beach Outpost will make your players think twice about attacking from the water. With ballistae on towers to rain down death on any invaders (especially invading Kaiju), this map has everything you need for an epic battle!

This battlemap will help bring your seafairing adventures to life! With JPEGs for VTTs like Foundry or Roll20, as well as a high-quality printable PDF file, there are no limits on where you can stage your session. Make sure to check out our other maps too—I've got enough for almost every adventure imaginable.

boardgame.name: Beach Shallows
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're looking for a water battlemap?

Beach Shallows is perfect for any water-based encounter in your campaign. It's also great if you want to extend the battle on the beach or transition into an underwater adventure. The map can be used with VTTs like Roll20 and Foundry, as well as easily printed at home.

This map will make your players think twice about their next move! As a perfect transition to Fortified Beach Outpost, they'll have to decide whether they want to continue fighting in the water or climb up onto land, where there might be more enemies waiting. But, if they choose land, then this could lead them straight into their enemies’ hands! Don't worry, though—I’m sure they’ll enjoy the combat either way.

boardgame.name: Blood Marsh Fortified Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a new map to spice up your D&D campaign?

I have the perfect map for you! This is Blood Marsh Fortified Outpost, a realistic and detailed battlemap of an outpost overlooking a bloody swamp. It's perfect for VTTs like Roll20 or Foundry, as well as easy home printing.

The detail on this map is incredible - it even has a private journal that could be used to describe a losing struggle against the vicious monsters in the swamp below. You'll be able to use this map in most fantasy campaigns with ease. And if you're looking for more maps, I also have plenty more available! Check them out on my publisher page.

boardgame.name: Invading Chimera (M&M)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Someone in this camp ain't who what he appears to be." - R.J. MacReady, John Carpenter's The Thing

From Jacob Blackmon (author of the fan-favorite Super Powered Legends Line) comes a new creepy (but also familiar) foe ready to menance your M&M game!

The Invading Chimera is an alien being from beyond this world. It is dangerous, intelligent, and incredibly deadly; willing to kill anyone and everything in its path in order to just survive.
And survival is what these creatures do best!
As a means of survival, they assume the form of living creatures around them, and mimic their mannerisms to blend in.

But the true form of these creatures is more horrible than one can imagine. These aliens are formless masses of protoplasm. Their genetic intelligence is carried in every single cell of their body. So if even a single drop of blood survives, then the chimera survives.

The monsters to be found in these "YOUniversal Monster" products are new builds, designed to be supervillains in their own right. This build is PL 7 with a variety of powers and abilities, ambitions, goals, and three different adventure ideas.

boardgame.name: Madness by Proxy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Target PCs: 4 to 6 heroes, Level 1 to 3

Maps: Yes

Pre-Gens: No

Run Time: One or two 4-hour sessions

Madness By Proxy presents a standalone adventure for the [rpgitem346573 Gaslight] setting compatible with the Low Fantasy Gaming system by Pickpocket Press. It is an investigative scenario, pitting the heroes not against clear-cut enemies of demonic nightmare, but against the even more insidious blackness of the human soul. Can the heroes uncover the crimes of the past to bestow justice in the present, or will their deeds only make things worse for the future?

Included in this adventure is the first set of rules for including Blackfog in your campaign. The Blackfog is a sinister bank of roiling vapors that arise whenever the darkness is complete. It brings terror, madness, and panic to those caught in it, and sometimes takes them altogether.

If you enjoy the Gaslight setting, be sure to check out the Gaslight Toolkit to convert your standard Low Fantasy Gaming campaign to the Fourth Age. Also, full writeups for currently released character classes customized for the setting can be found in Volume I of the Gaslight Character Class Pack.

Happy Adventuring, and...leave the lights burning.

boardgame.name: Bad Dogs!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behind the humans' backs animals are secretely able to talk and use things. And they have their own secret society... but aren't exactly keen on obeying the law. Bad Dogs! is a mini-setting that lets you become a gang of pets - whether to take the vile gangs down, carry out daring heists or to become the new king of the district!

Inside you'll find:

Rules to create a canine, feline or rodent gangster.
Two new skills, twenty new Edges and Hindrances - for both "animal" and "gangster" aspects of your hero.
A system to train your human.
Rules to mark territory, pull off the Trenchcoat Totem Pole trick, fighting fleas, and more!
System of achievements (lifted from Clock and Dagger) to run your own Gang.
GM-ing tips on how to cross the human and animal world and a random adventure generator.
A description of the decayed urban landscapes of Big City and the world of pets on its outskirts.
A gallery of Five Families running the City from behind the scenes!

boardgame.name: BattleTech: MapPack – Deserts
boardgame.description: Created using the same brilliant aesthetics of the new box sets and Grasslands and Battle of Tukayyid mapsets, these maps include a variety of terrain elements that deliver interesting battlefields for players of every skill level. Each map is 17” x 22”, paper, and may be placed side-on or edge-on with other maps for expanded battlefields.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: MapPack – Grasslands
boardgame.description: Expanding directly on the all-new maps found in the BattleTech Beginner Box and BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat box set, Map Set: Grasslands includes six double-sided maps: providing twelve brand-new battlefields for players old and new! Created using new art in the brilliant aesthetics of the new box sets, these maps include a variety of terrain elements that deliver interesting battlefields for players of every skill level.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: GARAGE: Bad Trip
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Top down shooter where you play as the drug dealer Butch as he tries to save a girl from the living dead.

boardgame.name: MechWarrior: Destiny
boardgame.description: MechWarrior: Destiny is a new way to dive into the action-packed BattleTech universe. Based on the easy-to-learn Cue System, MechWarrior: Destiny is a narrative-focused role-playing experience that has all you need to grab some equipment, load your sidearm, and strap into a ’Mech, aerospace fighter, or tank to fight for what you believe in, be it honor, glory, or even the almighty C-Bill. Loads of characters, ’Mechs, and other military hardware make it easy to start trading fire on 31st-century battlefields in no time. MechWarrior: Destiny also includes rules for incorporating play in BattleTech’s Total Warfare and Alpha Strike games.

set in a stylish alternative version of 1988

Black Future ’88 is a Synth-Punk roguelike 2D action Shooter
