boardgame.name: Get married 10 billion wives!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

I apologize in advance if you’re expecting some kind of explanation, that’s not what this place is about. No lore to be found, only wives, spouses, soulmates, partners, whatever you want to call them, it’s about finding those special someones you want to spend the rest of your life with.

boardgame.name: The Groundz
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A sci-fi game of dodge ball!

Originally made for Independent Game Festival 2020

boardgame.name: Battletech: Clan Support Star
boardgame.description:
A withering fusillade of firepower from the Clans' technologically advanced OmniMechs can cut a swath through even the mightiest wall of defenders. The superior firepower of these designs gives a Clan commander an even greater edge.

Unleash the Clan Fire Star on your enemies! Arctic Cheetah, Battle Cobra, Black Lanner, Linebacker and Night Gyr—no assembly required—along with five MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for Battletech and Alpha Strike action!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Melody for Eternity: Dokkalfar
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

MELODY FOR ETERNITY: DOKKALFAR is a minimalist role-playing game where you clandestinely perform assassination, sabotage and theft missions using your elven abilities, taking care not to end up betrayed by your allies.

Features:

· Pocket and portable format.

· Light rules system for playing treacherous and unethical adventures.

Follow Mundos Infinitos to receive news. I hope you enjoy my game. If yo

boardgame.name: Tides: Fun in the Sun
boardgame.description:
The best finds aren't always on the surface. Take a few moments to dig and dive for buried treasures that will make your art pop.

Shuffle these 3 cards into the deck to give some new special abilities.

If you have any of these new card abilities in your hand, you may use the special ability as an action during the required Tide Phase. Once used, discard the card.


Tides: Fun in the Sun is not expected to be released in Board Game of the Month Club packages.

boardgame.name: Death by Goblins!
boardgame.description:
A short-but-deadly adventure for 6th-level characters

From the introduction:

Death by Goblins! is [an] adventure designed for a party of four to six 6th-level characters. It should take between 6 and 12 hours to play, depending on the characters’ choices, making it ideal as a fun breather between two longer campaigns. 6th-level characters gain access to a slew of awesome new abilities, and this adventure is designed around giving players opportunities to test them out. This adventure should provide characters with about half of the experience points needed to advance from 6th to 7th level.

boardgame.name: Wastelands
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Near the end of the 22nd century, the world changed. Cities died in atomic fire, triggered by fools and arrogant tyrants. Corporations became more powerful than nations, and greedily divided the world up among them. Much of the remaining human race now lives in corporate enclaves, massive walled cities that are sanitized and sterile. Wars are fought between corporations now, and nations are a thing of the past. And magic has returned.

boardgame.name: Unauthorized Anarchy
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Unauthorized Anarchy presents a mixture of rules primarily derived from published System Reference Documents, often intermixed, and augmented by ideas and commentary on how they should - or at least could - be used for roleplaying. The intent is to present a fully modular game where every subsystem is optional, and where many subsystems have various implementations from which to choose.

The primary resources utilized are System Reference Document, d20 Modern System Reference Document, and System Reference Document 5.1 (SRD5).

boardgame.name: Sexcraft: A Little Game With a Lot of Sex
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The fight was over. Both of them knew that. All that remained was the surrender.

She looked down at him. His limbs lay still. No strength at all. He had used all of it fighting her relentless attacks. He heard her staggered breath. It had not been easy getting here. More than once, he thought he had broken through her defenses. But each time he thought he had her, she countered and reversed the advantage.

User summary:

This version of the game is extracted from The Big Book of Little Games.

boardgame.name: Why We Hunt
boardgame.description:
publisher blub

Why We Hunt is a rules-lite collaborative storytelling game for all players. With Why We Hunt, you can roleplay anywhere you are, with minimal prep and materials.


The crackle of the kindling is all that breaks the silence as you sit around a fire. Exhausted, tested, you take rest after your last hunt. Looking about you, your fellow hunters also sit in quiet contemplation. As you think back on this latest excursion, you can’t help but wonder why we hunt?


Why We Hunt is a collaborative storytelling game where a group recounts the tale of the last hunt they went on together. What they were hunting, and why, is entirely up to you. Details of the story are revealed as players take turns telling different parts, while bringing one another’s hunters to the brink. There is no GM here. The players alone dictate the pace and finality of the story, so make the story your own!

boardgame.name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Wrath of Snake Mountain
boardgame.description:
Wrath of Snake Mountain expansion brings an entirely new faction to Clash for Eternia, featuring the fearsome Preternian villains that hail from Snake Mountain, each with their own skill paths, unique abilities, and cards to be played on the side of the Controller, Player, or as an A.I. controlled character!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Clash for Eternia

boardgame.name: TiTS: Trials in Tainted Space
Trials in Tainted Tabletops
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Trials in Tainted Space is an erotic, ultimately customizable, roleplaying adventure game. It's a game as much about changing your character and those you meet as it is about exploration and adventure. You play as a personalized Player Character bent on making his or her fortune among the stars, starting out with only a ship, a crew of fellow adventurers, and a heart full of wanderlust. From there, you plunder the mysteries of the universe... particularly if they're curvy, well hung, or both. It's about discovering the exotic and the erotic.

boardgame.name: The Witcher Setting
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Witcher dark fantasy setting is the creation of Andrzej Sapkowsi in his The Last Wish series and given further life in The Witcher. Perhaps the most defining feature of the setting is how many of the stories subvert traditional fairy tales in darkly humorous ways.

User summary:

The Witcher Setting presents various implementation options and variant rules to enable play in the style of The Witcher.

boardgame.name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – The Evil Horde
boardgame.description:
The Evil Horde expansion brings an entirely new faction to Clash for Eternia comprised of an all-new set of nefarious villains, each with their own skill paths, unique abilities, and cards to be played on the side of the Controller, Player, or as an AI-controlled character.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Clash for Eternia

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Linked Weapons Pack
boardgame.description: This expansion for Car Wars (Sixth Edition) adds 56 Linked Weapon cards and 12 Turreted Weapons cards to the game.

boardgame.name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Assault on Castle Greyskull
boardgame.description:
Assault on Castle Grayskull’s new game mode puts players into one of two teams: the aggressors, who are attempting to take down the castle walls to gain control of Castle Grayskull, and the defenders, who must attempt to withstand the siege and protect its magical secrets.

This expansion brings powerful tools for both defenders and aggressors alike. As the game progresses, you will choose powerful Upgrades that aid you in your attack or defense of Grayskull: Should you play as the defender, you will have the castle’s full array of tools at your disposal. Build a mighty Laser Turret to rain down firepower on your foes! Raise your Banners high to grant boosts to your troops! As the aggressor, cunning strategies and tools are available to you as you plan your assault: Force Shields, Battle Ladders, and more are at your disposal.

—description from the publisher

Expansion comes with 2d castle overlay. Plastic Castle Greyskull must be purchased separately.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Clash for Eternia

boardgame.name: Musical Mages
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You all are a group of rival wizards, holding your annual meeting to compare the latest fantastical spell you’ve created.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Armory Pack
boardgame.description: This expansion for Car Wars (Sixth Edition) adds 64 more Weapons cards and 12 Turreted Weapon cards to the game.

boardgame.name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – She-Ra and the Great Rebellion
boardgame.description:
She-Ra and the Great Rebellion expansion brings an entire new faction to Clash for Eternia, with a numerous roster of characters, each with their own skill paths, unique abilities and cards to be played on the side of the Controller, Player, or as an A.I. controlled character.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Clash for Eternia

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Crew Pack
boardgame.description: This expansion for Car Wars (Sixth Edition) adds 72 crew cards, 4 accessory cards, 16 gear cards, and 4 sidearm cards to the game. It also includes crew tokens, barrel tokens, wall and barrier tokens, and a rulesheet.

boardgame.name: Carbyne Jungle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Set thousands of years into a distant future, Carbyne Jungle combines elements of Fantasy, Sci-Fi, Noir, and Horror, into a rich gaming experience. Built on the Tri-Forge Engine, Carbyne Jungle has three styles of gameplay, customizable for beginners through advanced players, so whoever is at the table can jump into the game. The setting is both in-depth and flexible allowing A GM to dive right into the universe, forge their own world, or anywhere in between. With phenomenal battles, meaningful non-combat conflicts, and an incredibly flexible advancement system, Carbyne Jungle is the game you’ve been waiting for.

boardgame.name: Magnate: Tycoon Mini-Expansions
boardgame.description:
This contains a City Hall miniature (no game function) and 3 modules:


Luxury Apartment Towers: A powerful, high value home building.
Blind Bidding: Replaces the Turn Order rules with a blind auction for turn order.
Employees: Replaces the Advertise Action with a deck of employees you can hire that grant special abilities.

listing.notes:
Kickstarter Exclusive
Add new possibilities and depth to your city. These mini-expansions can be added to any game separately or combined as you wish.
If you choose to use poker chips instead of Magnate's paper money, the supplied bidding screens conveniently replace the base game's wallets to keep your money secret.
Contents:
27 Employee cards 5 Bidding screens 1 Turn order board 3 Luxury apartment tower miniatures 4 Luxury apartment tower footprints 1 City hall miniature 1 Rulebook

boardgame.name: Not F.A.T.A.L. but Serious
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A politically incorrect guide to supplement Role Playing games to make them very offensive to "Social Justice" types.
...
This is for those sick of “Political Correctness” and the excessive “Social Justice” and those extremists that commit crimes and harassment over the slightest offense in real life over outrages real and imagined. This is for those who like the “Role Playing Game” hobby and have noticed hucksters pretending there is a ‘sexism’, ‘racism’ whatever problem to try to get wealthy at the expense of the hobby. This is for those who care about “Free Speech” noting that there is nothing out there worth anything that does not offend someone somewhere and if we let people who are offended edit out things we will have nothing.

boardgame.name: Lewd Attack
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Lewd Attack ​is a roleplaying game intended for solo-play that combines sexual themes with fantasy adventures. Player-Characters are female adventurers seeking glory and fame while struggling with their own desires in a standardish fantasy world. “Lewd Attack”, because the characters have, among other options, the ability to use their womanly charms against the enemy. Want to play a strong knight that smashes evil and later lets off some steam with a bunch of men in the tavern? A seductive thief that uses her enemies lust against them? Or a pious priestess desperately protecting her innocence? Or will you fall to depravity, getting lost in a spiral of more and more dangerous sex

boardgame.name: Inner Kingdoms Scenarios
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

All relevant scenarios, events, exploration, environments and quests for the Inner Kingdoms for the game Lewd Attack.

boardgame.name: Inner Kingdoms Companions
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This document covers creating, recruiting and dealing with companions, mercenaries and other available adventurers that may accompany your character on your adventures, and the relevant mechanics.

boardgame.name: Clans of the Frontier
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Unforgiving. Unrelenting. Untamed. Beyond the natural borders of the Stukov Desert, the Janus Crater, and the Gauntlet lies a savage frontier that defies the iron grip of the Cults. The inhabitants of this landscape bend their knee to different laws, to different kings, to different powers altogether. This is their story.

Four Clans like no other have their roots in the Frontier. The Britoni rage against the overwhelming tide of the outside world, the Pictons prowl the coasts on behalf of their enigmatic god, the Druids step forth from their forest for the first time in centuries, and the Ganarids drift between them all.

This supplement contains character creation rules and rank progression for adding characters hailing from the major Clans of Northwest Franka, exploring their individual origins and the struggles they each must face to survive in the harsh environment of their home.

CONTENTS


A close look at the four major Clans surrounding Briton: the Britoni, the Pictons, the Druids, and the Ganarids
Character generation rules, ranks, and unique Potentials for each Clan, giving a deep look at their culture and place in the world
Details of unique special equipment for use by Pictons or Druids, cutting edge technology passed down from their gods

boardgame.name: Flee Fi Fo From
boardgame.description:
“Halt! What business have you in our glorious city? Sir, kind sir, please let us in! Our villages were plundered by the giants not two days past. Flee we did, but they come behind us! Won’t you take us in? Nearby villages you say? Hmm, you provide us much grain. Our city council perchance might let you in. But you must show us your papers. Queue up! Our glorious knights can fend off the giants.”

In Flee Fi Fo From, players take on the role of competing clans attempting to protect villagers from rampaging giants by bringing them to safety within the city walls. Clans are not saving people out of pure altruism though - they have their own agenda to gain influence in the city council. The clan with the most influence points at the end wins the game.

The game is played over a series of Action and Reset turns. First the player with the action marker performs up to 2 actions (Authorize, Riot, Swap or Escort). These typically involve selecting villagers to be admitted to the city and moving them forward. Following this, the reset player is responsible for maintaining the flow of villagers towards the city, but may also choose to abandon the rescue efforts by retreating the defending knights instead.

The game ends when either all villagers have been saved or too many knights have retreated from the battlefield.

Scores are a total of villagers rescued, hidden objectives, end game bonuses and rating. The player with the most influence points wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Arcadia Quest: Poison Dragon
boardgame.description:
The Poison Dragon is an expansion for both Arcadia Quest, and Arcadia Quest inferno.

It all started with the smell. At first, it just seemed like something had gone off, but it soon grew worse and worse until … Rotwailer the deadly Poison Dragon made her epic entrance at the gates of Arcadia! Unless the Heroes of the city can stop fighting among themselves long enough to focus on this vile monster. Arcadia's future doesn't smell good.

Arcadia Quest: Poison Dragon is an expansion that extends any campaign in the Arcadia Quest line into a truly epic encounter against the sickening Poison Dragon! Divided into two scenarios, Heroes will first need to compete to bring down the dragon, and then cooperate to ultimately defeat it.

boardgame.name: Minecraft: Builders & Biomes – Fishing Rod and Shovel promo cards
boardgame.description:
Contains 2 fishing rods and two shovel tiles. Part of the Spielbox magazine issue 5/2021

Fishing Rod (x2): If you reveal the fishing rod during a fish, after the fight is over, you may choose a revealed mob from the grid and place it next to your board to "reserve" it. Put the fishing rod on that mob card. During the rest of the game, whenever you fight a mob, you can choose to fight your reserved mob instead of one from the grid. Both the mob card and the fishing rod stay reserved next to your board until you have defeated the mob. When you defeat it, the fishing rod is shuffled back into your weapon pile. Reserved mobs do not provide any bonuses until they are defeated.

Shovel (x2): If you reveal the shovel during a fight, aft the fight is over, you may choose a revealed building card from the grid and place it next to your board to "reserve" it. Put the shovel on that building card. During the rest of the game, whenever you execute the "build" action, you can choose to build the reserved structure if you have the resources to do so. Both the building card and the shovel stay reserved next to your board until you build the building. Once it is built, shuffle the shovel back into your weapons pile. Reserved buildings do not provide any bonuses until they are built.

boardgame.name: Urto
boardgame.description:
Urto. A competitive dungeon crawler for 2-5 players.

Players will explore a cave to find items and treasures, fight against against creatures and other players but always keeping an eye on other players because when the first one will go out of the cave, there will not be a lot of time to escape too. Urto will finally judge between the players that succeed to go out of the cave which one had been the best hero.

During a turn, player will move one square and will have the possibility to explore, fight, sprint or rest. To perform these actions, he will have to roll dice or to pick cards.

The game ends when there is no more living hero in the cave.

To win, players have to not die in the cave and to be the hero with the biggest score adding honour points, magic points and health points.

boardgame.name: TRAILS: Deluxe Resources
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your TRAILS experience with deluxe wooden resources. These resources are custom cut, stained then screen printed to match the resource icons in the game.

Includes 45 (15 of each resource) stained and screen-printed wood pieces.

boardgame.name: Knights of the Round: Academy Quickstart
boardgame.description:
From Inside Book

Knights of the Round: Academy is a roleplay game inspired by shonen anime, by super and real robot anime from the ‘90s and by JRPGs.

KotR:A is a storytelling game where:

Pilots are one with their mechas
There is no technical detail about weapons or technology
There are no tables for range, damage or any other tactical detail
